intro: Urostachys sampaioanus, commonly known as the Sampaio's spurge, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in a cup-like structure called a cyathium. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
